Come on Google let us in!!!
I agree
"Already invited? We've temporarily exceeded our capacity. Please try again soon."
Ive just started using it, it's simple and easy to use i just wish more people i knew were on it

Looks like there should be a separate thread for invite begging and talking about Google+.
I'm not begging for an invite, at least not yet, but I'd like to know how the invite system is supposed to work.
One fellow on another forum said he has sent me an invite to one of my emails, (which is correct), but I haven't yet seen one coming from Google. How long do you usually have to wait? How soon have you received your invites?

Other than that, I think Google should soon open the service up to the mere mortals, or otherwise the service may indeed become yet another Wave.

@iurus No idea really. I invited a few people and some got in and others not. Not sure how they are determining who gets and who does not. I hope they open it soon cause there's a bunch of people I want to test with :)

Okay. I'll just wait, then. I wonder if the pecking order is: Gmail users first, the rest of the poor beggars some time later, if ever..? 
I for one don't use Gmail.

I wonder how well Google+ might work for playing RPGs.  That's what I intend to try to use it for if it turns out to be good for that.  I'm thinking of a kind of desktop mapping utility that can be shared with live messaging feedback from the players.  Anyone have any thoughts on that?

For one the invite system is turned off the first day there were too many invites going out, google+ is actually just like Facebook only cool thing is hangouts which is a video chat room with up to 8people and for RPG one there is no API for now and two no chat just baked in gtalk so don't see how an RPG would work
@italiano40 I think it's more than just that. Circles is a way better design than the Facebook friend model. Ability to "follow" people's streams without a two way friend link as well.

@penkin yea circles is facebook list and people hate list, facebook list failed, twitter list failed list are dumb and make it a new name and making all pretty doesn't the underlying fail, and i hate that people can follow me i end up blocking them which isn't the proper way it should be handled, google+ is cool just for hangouts

I agree with @penkin. circle is different from 'friends' and 'list' although it's based on the same idea. circle kinda force you to do list in order to follow, you might just do it right. uni friends, hs friends, colleagues, friend-nemy, skanks &sluts, and so on…
@unwrangle i was totally against the circles, but you threw in the shanks&sluts circle i may have to rethink my position on this circle thing LMAO

@italiano40 people can only follow your public stream, not what you post to a specific circle. For me, hangout sucks cause I'm in a 3rd world with crappy bandwidth :( Tried it once but it was too jerky to have an actual conversation.

@italiano40 lol yeah. I mean, I love my friends & family, but often time it's just rude to not 'friend' or 'follow' them yet I have a need to 'mute' them... maybe, in a way fb / twitter list failed because it is another step to organize? and circle maybe the answer by being the front and center of the network. Can't wait for iOS app with huddle...
How do U even find it I can't even get on the sight

currently aggressively making my friends using it... glad that the responses are quite positive so far.
at least this time of the year the get the job done much better than that of wave/buzz times...

Google + is open to google account holders don't buy one!!

Yes, it would be pretty pointless to pay for invites to a free online service, which is to be open to anyone soon. 
BTW, not even an invitation seems to be a sure way to get in. Looks like they are taking people in in some random interval. I did get myself a Gmail account, though, so it's difficult to say if that was a key factor, because at first it had no effect whatsoever, but then suddenly I got in. The only factor that changed was the time of the day. So go figure.
I'm still on the waiting list.
i got mine today, it's rocking

What's the best way to mention someone else in a google+ post?
Like a twitter public reply: I can't figure out how to say "I'm hanging out with [insert friend's google+ handle or analog here].
Any tips?
@kringo use @ like every other social network js
@ and + seem to work the same way
I always use +, you get a nice autocomplete if you do that. Just type + and then start typing the name
yeah,.. feels weird since g+ use full name, not username
who tested the hangouts thing?.. its cool.. =)
Meh, I'm still waiting on google apps (organizations) to get profiles

Maybe there could be a drop down like in Facebook with a single click option for Google+ users with a Gmail account (Most of us) "Move conversation to Gmail".  This would be good for those who turn off email notifications.

You can send someone a personal message by sharing something with them only and disabling sharing but how can personal messages be elevated above the stream so they don't get lost?  Should direct messages, or DM'shave their own place in the Google bar?
How does Google+ empower its users to take greater control over their lives, and gather together their communities?
